metadata.source: Phil-LiDAR 2 Program Nationwide Detailed Resources Assessment
metadata.description: Provincial renewable energy potential data for AI-driven energy system recommendations

units.solar: Wh/m²/day (Watt-hours per square meter per day)

primary_energy_selection: Select energy sources with 'high', 'very_high', or 'exceptional' viability ratings
Consider local resource availability and sustainability
Factor in technology maturity and infrastructure requirements
secondary_energy_selection: Consider 'moderate' viability sources as backup or complementary options
hybrid_system_consideration: Recommend hybrid systems when multiple sources have moderate-to-high viability
Solar + Wind: Complementary generation patterns (day/night, seasonal)
Solar + Biomass: Provides baseload + peak generation
Hydro + Solar: Seasonal water availability complemented by solar
Biomass + Wind: Consistent baseload with wind peaks
location_specific_factors: Geography: Island vs mainland affects grid connection
Population density: Higher density favors larger centralized plants
Existing infrastructure: Grid connection vs microgrid
Land availability: Affects solar farm and biomass processing facility sizing
Water resources: Critical for hydropower feasibility
Agricultural waste streams: Ensures biomass fuel supply chain
